intro: Agalinis caddoensis, commonly known as Caddo eveningflower, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as prairies and wetlands. It has slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Agalinis caddoensis is often found in association with other native wildflowers in its native range.
